job_description: Position:  Technology Delivery Transformation Co-opCompany:  Tantalus Systems Corp.Terms:  From May 2015 - Would like a Coop that can do 2 terms back to backWe are seeking a Co-op Student to join the Technology Delivery Transformation team.  This group focuses on understanding, identifying, developing and implementing process improvements and standard operating procedures to maximize efficiencies and to ultimately exceed internal & external service levels. This is open to all disciplines – be it Engineering, Computer Science or Management/Business.Some of the key functions into this role are:1. Data Analysis and issue investigation.• Consolidate data from  many reports to correspond with system or process problems and to analyze data to find trends and particularities and depending on findings search for extra data that further depicts what was found and to summarize findings clearly and precisely2. Presenting and Writing Reports based on Data Analysis findings• Create and update issue entries in Process Management System based on outcomes of data analysis and provide clear and sufficient information so that others can work on the issue with a full understanding of the problem• Generate presentations, graphs and charts as well as individual examples to present to Product Development and Senior Management3. Summarizing Daily Reports• Perform daily tasks involving summarizing multiple reports that track system performance or status of certain devices4. Updating records• Update internal records and process to correspond with changes in the Business Process• Update documents to be given within the Business Process and Product Development functions
job_requirements: Experience Required:1. Microsoft applications: Excel (Pivot Tables, Data Importing, Formulas), Outlook, Visio (an asset)2. Data entry/transfer (Excel spreadsheet to Project Management tool such as Mingle or Agile Jira)3. Use of PowerPoint (critical) - ability to craft semi-high quality presentations with decent use of data visualizations in the presentation.Personal Attributes Required:1. Problem solving and strong Analytical skills -  an ability to easily and quickly pick out trends from data2. Ability to simply summarize findings in a visual format using excel3. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.4. Good interpersonal skills including: teamwork, respect & courtesy.Additional constraints1. NSERC funding eligible2. 2nd year or above3. Business/Management/Computer Science or Engineering disciplineOpen To All Majors:No
